page.title: 18WETHERBY STAINED GLASS
page.content: As we approached the door we could see panes of glass leant against the wall. There was a wooden staircase that was went up the right hand side of the room. This room was very small. As you went up the stairs there were a few pictures hung on the wall. As you get to the top of the stairs you can see a workbench and pamphlets about the glass and a cash till. The thickness of the glass depends on what it is used for e.g. 4mm glass is used mostly for windows, 3mm is used mostly for greenhouses and churches and 2mm is used for patterned glass. They mend all stained glass upstairs and all normal glass downstairs. The shapes of glass are fastened with either lead or copper strips, soldered and puttied. They also made novelty toys and lampshades.
